meanings.definition: Infinite time; duration without beginning or end.
meanings.sent1: The concept of eternity can be hard to grasp.
meanings.sent2: She believed their love would last for eternity.
meanings.sent3: The eternal wait for the bus made him chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The stars seemed to twinkle for an eternity in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The old tree stood tall, a symbol of eternity in the forest.

meanings.definition: Time without end; a state to which time has no application; timelessness.
meanings.sent1: The idea of eternity brings a sense of peace.
meanings.sent2: The beauty of the landscape seemed to stretch into eternity.
meanings.sent3: The eternal ticking of the clock became a comforting sound.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, filling it with a sense of eternity.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured a moment of eternity in its colors and strokes.

meanings.definition: A state of existence outside time, especially the state of existence after death.
meanings.sent1: Many religions believe in an eternity afterlife.
meanings.sent2: The thought of eternity after death can be comforting to some.
meanings.sent3: The eternal peace of the cemetery was a stark contrast to the bustling city.
meanings.sent4: His words lingered in the room, hanging in the air like an eternity.
meanings.sent5: The old man spoke of an eternity beyond this world with a twinkle in his eye.
